message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia increases the risk of endometrial cancer, especially in women with risk factors like obesity and diabetes. Megestrol acetate can be used to manage the hyperplasia and prevent progression to cancer. Anastrozole is used to treat breast cancer, Estrogen-progestin contraceptives increase the risk of breast cancer and may worsen the hyperplasia, and Nafarelin is used for endometriosis and other gynecological conditions but is not indicated for hyperplasia management.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia puts the patient at risk for endometrial cancer, and Megestrol acetate is a medication that can help reduce the risk of cancer development. Anastrozole is for breast cancer treatment, estrogen-progestin contraceptives can worsen hyperplasia, and Nafarelin is used for endometriosis treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Simple endometrial hyperplasia can progress to endometrial cancer, especially in postmenopausal women with risk factors such as obesity, diabetes, and hypertension. Among the options, Megestrol acetate is used to treat endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. Anastrozole is used for breast cancer and estrogen-progestin contraceptives and Nafarelin are not appropriate for treating endometrial hyperplasia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s endometrial biopsy showed simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia, indicating an increased risk of endometrial cancer. Megestrol acetate is a progestin that can help reverse hyperplasia and reduce the risk of cancer. Anastrozole is for treating breast cancer, and estrogen-progestin contraceptives are not appropriate for this patient with a history of hypertension and obesity. Nafarelin is a synthetic hormone used to treat endometriosis, not hyperplasia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia can be treated with progestins. Megestrol acetate is a progestin and is the most appropriate treatment option. Anastrozole is an aromatase inhibitor used for breast cancer treatment, and it is not indicated in this case. Estrogen-progestin contraceptives are not indicated because they contain estrogen and can exacerbate the hyperplasia. Nafarelin is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist for endometriosis treatment and is not indicated in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s endometrial biopsy results suggest simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia, and among the options, megestrol acetate is the most appropriate treatment for this condition. Anastrozole is used for breast cancer treatment, estrogen-progestin contraceptives are not indicated for endometrial hyperplasia, and nafarelin is used for endometriosis or central precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia increases the risk of endometrial cancer, and treatment should be initiated. Megestrol acetate is a progestin that can be used to manage endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. Anastrozole is an aromatase inhibitor used in breast cancer treatment, estrogen-progestin contraceptives are not recommended in women with diabetes and hypertension, and Nafarelin is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist used in endometriosis and fertility treatments.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. With the diagnosis of simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia, the best next step in management is Megestrol acetate, which is a progestin medication used to treat endometrial hyperplasia. Anastrozole is used to treat breast cancer, estrogen-progestin contraceptives are used for birth control and can increase the risk of endometrial hyperplasia, and Nafarelin is used to treat endometriosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia, which has a low risk of progressing to endometrial cancer. Megestrol acetate is used to treat simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. Anastrozole is used to treat breast cancer and has not been shown to be effective in treating endometrial hyperplasia. Estrogen-progestin contraceptives are not recommended in this case as they contain estrogen, which can stimulate endometrial growth. Nafarelin is used to treat endometriosis, not endometrial hyperplasia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's endometrial biopsy shows simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. Megestrol acetate can be used to treat this condition as it is a progestin that helps regulate the endometrial lining. Anastrozole is not used to treat endometrial hyperplasia. Estrogen-progestin contraceptives are not recommended as they contain estrogen which can increase the risk of endometrial hyperplasia. Nafarelin is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist which is not indicated for the treatment of simple endometrial hyperplasia.
